thread.title: Red-faced Helen Flanagan targeted by cruel trolls as she attempts to host Coronation Street Q
thread.title_full: Red-faced Helen Flanagan targeted by cruel trolls as she attempts to host Coronation Street Q

author: Nicola Agius
title: Red-faced Helen Flanagan targeted by cruel trolls as she attempts to host Coronation Street Q
text:
Get soaps     
Helen Flanagan was left red-faced following a Coronation Street Twitter Q&A this evening. 
The actress reprised the role of Rosie Webster earlier this week and so decided to take to social media tonight to talk to fans and reveal some backstage secrets. 
However, cruel Twitter trolls used this as an opportunity to try and put the star down. 
One wrote: "@itvcorrie Helen how much acting goes into the part of vacuous airhead Rosie Webster and how much is natural ? #AskCorrie." Helen Flanagan's Coronation Street return as Rosie Webster divides opinion (Photo: ITV) 
nother then commented: "@itvcorrie why is your acting so appalling? #askcorrie #pleaseleave." Read More Coronation Street extends Helen Flanagan's contract despite viewer complaints about her acting 
Shortly afterwards, a different Twitter user posted: "@itvcorrie #AskCorrie when are you leaving? Your acting is worse than it was before." 
Fortunately, Helen didn't pay any attention to the negative comments as she answered questions from REAL Corrie fans. Read More 
When asked who is she closest to on the cobbles, Helen answered: "My FAVE person is @BrookeLVincent - she is my best friend on the show. She's the most fun person! - HF #AskCorrie." Helen Flanagan's Coronation Street return as Rosie Webster divides opinion (Photo: ITV) 
Opening up about hos ROsie has changed over the years, she added: "She's more mature now - it's five years on. When she was younger she was a bit b****y but she's got a good heart - HF #AskCorrie." 
Helen then revealed what it's like backstage: "We have fun during rehearsal but on a take - never! HF - #AskCorrie." Helen Flanagan's Coronation Street return as Rosie Webster divides opinion (Photo: ITV) 
Hitting back at Twitter trolls earlier on in the day, Helen posted a snap on Instagram with a caption which read: â€œNo matter how rich, cool, educated, or talented you believe you are, how you treat people ultimately tells all. Integrity is everything." 
*Coronation Street returns to ITV tomorrow at 7.30pm and 8.30pm Like us on Facebook
